page.title: 03PARISH COUNCIL (1)
page.content: The Parish Council, is the central point in the working of the local authority, although it may appoint subcommittees of which at least two thirds of the members must be parish councillers. The council is required to hold an annual meeting and to meet on at least three other occasions throughout the year. In practice most councils meet either monthly or quarterly, with occasional additional meetings. The Parish Council as an executive body is endowed with statutory powers, some of which are obligatery whilst others are optional. It is expected, and is often asked to voice the views of the community it repersents on many matters eg: planning applications, local plans, etc: It is also asked to nominate persons to outside bodies.
